Title: "An Echo from Across the Sea"

In Boston's shadow, a Ilanguage unfurls,
Young, like life, unseen as death nears.
Mexico's sun sets on childhood's pearls,
A kiss then, first salve for a wound's tiers.
Daughter, mother – distant, yet bound,
In the cold grip of lost years,
Where pain is drawn from grief's deep well-spring,
A kiss echoes, welcome and clear.
